channel.title: Password was removed after repair
channel.description:
I have got my PC back from repair and now I discover that passwords on both my accounts was removed and Administrator account added, what is the reason, and how can I prevent this to happen later.
Using Windows 7 RC.

item.title: Password was removed after repair
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

But is there any with experience with Truecrypt?
It warn me about using it on systempartition if I dual-boot, anyone know what the danger is, as this is the only way I know securing my computer?

Read full topic

item.title: Password was removed after repair
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

The account ‘Administrator’ comes default on all Microsoft releases; it’s similar to *NIX root (but way less powerful).

Read full topic

item.title: Password was removed after repair
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:4, topic:282436”]It was replacing the old keyboard with a new one, the strange thing is that they also removed my MSN password and changes some settning in a emulator I have on my computer, but what did they do, and how to prevent other access my computer like that again.[/quote]Don’t use windows. Only way.

Read full topic

item.title: Password was removed after repair
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Did you mean they repaired your laptop? Because you can just go to a shop and buy a new keyboard for a PC.

You should ask the repairmen what they did, it sounds like they were playing on it for fun. Why the hell would you need to run an emulator when replacing a keyboard?

Read full topic

item.title: Password was removed after repair
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

It was replacing the old keyboard with a new one, the strange thing is that they also removed my MSN password and changes some settning in a emulator I have on my computer, but what did they do, and how to prevent other access my computer like that again.

Read full topic

item.title: Password was removed after repair
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:1, topic:282436”]I have got my PC back from repair and now I discover that passwords on both my accounts was removed and Administrator account added, what is the reason, and how can I prevent this to happen later.

Using Windows 7 RC.[/quote]

Was this repair hardware only. Maybe they added a new device that needed a new driver to be installed. In that case they had to remove the password so they could access your computer!

Read full topic

item.title: Password was removed after repair
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

What did they repair?
